Relocate a column to a new position

Source: R/relocate.R
relocate..Rd

Move a column or columns to a new position

relocate.(.df, ..., .before = NULL, .after = NULL)

Arguments

.df

A data.frame or data.table
...

A selection of columns to move. tidyselect compatible.
.before

Column to move selection before
.after

Column to move selection after

Examples

test_df <- data.table(
  a = 1:5,
  b = 1:5,
  c = c("a","a","a","b","b"),
  d = c("a","a","a","b","b"))

test_df %>%
  relocate.(c, .before = b)

#> # tidytable [5 × 4]
#>       a c         b d    
#>   <int> <chr> <int> <chr>
#> 1     1 a         1 a    
#> 2     2 a         2 a    
#> 3     3 a         3 a    
#> 4     4 b         4 b    
#> 5     5 b         5 b    

test_df %>%
  relocate.(a, b, .after = c)

#> # tidytable [5 × 4]
#>   c         a     b d    
#>   <chr> <int> <int> <chr>
#> 1 a         1     1 a    
#> 2 a         2     2 a    
#> 3 a         3     3 a    
#> 4 b         4     4 b    
#> 5 b         5     5 b    

test_df %>%
  relocate.(where(is.numeric), .after = c)

#> # tidytable [5 × 4]
#>   c         a     b d    
#>   <chr> <int> <int> <chr>
#> 1 a         1     1 a    
#> 2 a         2     2 a    
#> 3 a         3     3 a    
#> 4 b         4     4 b    
#> 5 b         5     5 b
